meanings.definition: The state of being completely still or without movement.
meanings.sent1: The motionlessness of the cat made it hard to tell if it was real or a statue.
meanings.sent2: The motionlessness of the lake on a windless day was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The motionlessness of the sloth was so extreme that even the flies buzzing around it got bored.
meanings.sent4: In the motionlessness of the desert, time seemed to stand still.
meanings.sent5: The motionlessness of the owl as it waited for its prey was a testament to its patience.

meanings.sent1: The motionlessness of the street at night was eerie.
meanings.sent2: The motionlessness of the factory indicated that something was wrong.
meanings.sent3: The motionlessness of the playground at recess was a sign that the children were up to mischief elsewhere.
meanings.sent4: The motionlessness of the old clock on the wall made it seem like time had stopped.
meanings.sent5: The motionlessness of the spider in its web was a trap waiting to spring.
